data.title: The Greatest Puerto Rican Men
data.meta_description: This list of famous Puerto rican men may throw a few surprises at you!
data.text:
1

Joaquin Phoenix

(Best Known for His Role in the Films: 'Joker', 'Gladiator', 'The Master' and 'Walk the Line)

296

119

Birthdate: October 28, 1974

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Award-winning actor Joaquin Phoenix is widely regarded as one of the most talented actors of his generation. In his career of four decades, he has starred in numerous films playing characters that have become memorable. These include movies like Gladiator, Joker, Walk the Line and Her. The acclaimed actor is also a social activist, environmentalist, animal rights activist and producer.

2

Benicio Del Toro

(Actor and Producer Best Known for His Films ‘The Usual Suspects’, ‘Basquiat’ and ‘Snatch’)

80

37

Birthdate: February 19, 1967

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: San Germán, Puerto Rico

Born to lawyer parents, Puerto Rican actor-producer Benicio del Toro had initially taken up a business degree course in university. He later dropped out and joined a New York theater school. Known for his Academy Award-winning role in Traffic, del Toro is also an avid environmental activist.

3

Roberto Clemente

(Puerto Rican Professional Baseball Right Fielder)

432

94

Birthdate: August 18, 1934

Sun Sign: Leo

Birthplace: Carolina, Puerto Rico

Died: December 31, 1972

Roberto Clemente was a Puerto Rican baseball player who represented the Pittsburgh Pirates in Major League Baseball (MLB). Apart from being a popular player, Clemente was also a great humanitarian whose impact is still being felt in MLB. Since his untimely death at the age of 38, Clemente has been the subject of several documentaries, articles, and books.

Recommended Lists:

4

Miguel Cotto

(Puerto Rican Former Professional Boxer)

38

19

Birthdate: October 29, 1980

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Birthplace: Providence, Rhode Island, United States

American-born Puerto Rican retired boxer Miguel Cotto became the first Puerto Rican to win world boxing titles in four separate weight divisions. In 2017, he was ranked third in the best light middleweight category by The Ring magazine. He now owns a boxing promotion and a non-profit organization.

Recommended Lists:

5

Bad Bunny

(Puerto Rican Rapper, Singer-Songwriter & Record Producer)

322

113

Birthdate: March 10, 1994

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: Almirante Sur, Puerto Rico

Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny won a Latin Grammy for his debut album, X 100pre. His album YHLQMDLG was the highest-charting all-Spanish album on Billboard 200. He was the only male to be featured on a Playboy cover, apart from Hugh Hefner, and also released a COVID-19-inspired song on SoundCloud.

6

Ricky Martin

(Singer-songwriter Known For his Biggest Hit Song "Livin' la Vida Loca")

115

45

Birthdate: December 24, 1971

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

The King of Latin Pop Ricky Martin ruled the music scene of the 1990s, with hits such as Livin' La Vida Loca and The Cup of Life. He began performing with the band Menudo at age 12 and later released multiple Billboard number 1 albums as a solo artist.

Recommended Lists:

7

Daddy Yankee

(Rapper & Singer Known as The "King of Reggaetón" by Music Critics and Fans Alike)

177

54

Birthdate: February 3, 1977

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Daddy Yankee is a Puerto Rican rapper, singer-songwriter, and record producer. He is credited with coining the term Reggaeton. Referred to as the King of Reggaetón, Yankee has been cited as an inspiration by several performers, including Natti Natasha, J Balvin, and Ozuna. Also a noted philanthropist, Yankee donated $100,000 to provide food to 9,000 families affected by Hurricane Maria.

8

Luis Miguel

(Youngest Artist Ever to Win a Grammy at the Age of 14)

97

36

Birthdate: April 19, 1970

Sun Sign: Aries

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Luis Miguel is a Mexican singer. Having performed in a wide range of styles like pop and jazz, Miguel is considered the most successful artist in the history of Latin America. One of the best-selling Latin musicians ever, Miguel is credited with popularizing the bolero genre. Thanks to his popularity, he has been referred to as the Latin Frank Sinatra.

Recommended Lists:

9

Luis Guzmán

(Actor)

62

19

Birthdate: August 28, 1956

Sun Sign: Virgo

Birthplace: Cayey, Puerto Rico

Puerto Rican actor Luis Guzmán is best known for films such as Boogie Nights, The Limey, and Traffic. Audiences also loved him in the series Narcos. He has voiced Ricardo in two Grand Theft Auto video games and has delivered an award-winning performance in How to Make It in America.

10

Raul Julia

(Golden Globe- and Emmy-Winning Puerto Rican Actor)

64

19

Birthdate: March 9, 1940

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: Floral Park, San Juan, Puerto Rico

Died: October 24, 1994

Height: 6'2" (188 cm)

Recommended Lists:

11

Ozuna

(One of the Best-Selling Latin American Music Artists of All Time)

136

45

Birthdate: March 13, 1992

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Two-time Latin Grammy-winning Puerto Rican singer Ozuna specializes in the Latin trap and reggaeton genres. He is known for his Billboard-charting albums such as Aura. He collaborated with DJ Snake, Selena Gomez, and Cardi B on the phenomenal hit Taki Taki and has been cast in the film F9.

12

Anuel AA

(Rapper)

97

47

Birthdate: November 27, 1992

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Birthplace: Carolina

Anuel AA is a Puerto Rican singer and rapper. Regarded as one of the founding fathers and a pioneer of Latin trap music, Anuel AA often incorporates topics like sex and crime in his lyrics. Also one of the most controversial rappers of his generation, Anuel AA has had several legal issues; his debut album was recorded while being incarcerated.

Recommended Lists:

13

Luis Fonsi

(Puerto Rican Singer)

73

19

Birthdate: April 15, 1978

Sun Sign: Aries

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Puerto Rican singer Luis Fonsi became an international sensation with the track Despacito, which was the most-watched video on YouTube till November 2020. Also known for tracks such as Aquí Estoy Yo, he has broken several Guinness records and won five Latin Grammy awards. He also supports children with cancer.

14

Iván Rodríguez

(Former Puerto Rican Baseball Player Who Played as a Catcher)

26

10

Birthdate: November 27, 1971

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Birthplace: Manatí, Puerto Rico

Height: 5'9" (175 cm)

15

José Ferrer

(Actor and Director Best Known for His Films: ‘Moulin Rouge’, ‘The Caine Mutiny’ and ‘Lawrence of Arabia’)

66

14

Birthdate: January 8, 1912

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Died: January 26, 1992

José Ferrer was a Puerto Rican actor and director who established himself in the American theatre and film industry. He received an Academy Award for his performance in Cyrano de Bergerac, becoming the first Hispanic actor and the first Puerto Rican-born actor to win the award. In 1985, he became the first actor to receive the National Medal of Arts.

16

José Feliciano

(Puerto Rican Musician, Composer, and Singer)

32

10

Birthdate: September 10, 1945

Sun Sign: Virgo

Birthplace: Lares, Puerto Rico

José Feliciano is a Puerto Rican musician, composer, and singer. He achieved international fame in 1968 after the release of his album Feliciano! Since then, José Feliciano has released more than 50 albums worldwide. Feliciano was made an inductee of the International Latin Music Hall of Fame and the Latin Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2000 and 2013 respectively.

17

(Puerto Rican Reggaeton Singer and Actor)

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Birthplace: San Juan, Puerto Rico

Puerto Rican reggaeton singer Don Omar, better known as El Ray, or the King of Kings, shot to fame with hits such as Danza Kuduro. Audiences also loved him as Rico Santos in 4 films of the Fast & Furious franchise. His tracks are often based on socio-political themes

Chayanne

(Puerto Rican Latin Pop Singer and Actor)

12

Birthdate: June 28, 1968

Sun Sign: Cancer

Birthplace: Río Piedras, Puerto Rico

Puerto Rican Latin pop star and actor Chayanne has 7 Top 200 albums and has sold over 30 million albums globally. The Grammy-nominated singer has delivered hits such as Violeta and Te Deseo. He spent his later career in Miami and starred in movies such as Dance with Me.

David Zayas

(Puerto Rican Actor Best Known for His Role as ‘Angel Batista’ on Showtime's Series ‘Dexter’)

10

5

Birthdate: August 15, 1962

Sun Sign: Leo

Birthplace: Ponce, Puerto Rico

David Zayas is a Puerto Rican actor known for playing important roles in American TV series like Dexter, Oz, and Gotham. His portrayal of Angel Batista in Dexter earned him a Satellite Award and a nomination for the prestigious Screen Actors Guild Award.

Walter Mercado

(Puerto Rican Astrologer, Actor, and TV Personality)

8

Birthdate: March 9, 1932

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: Ponce, Puerto Rico

Died: November 2, 2019

Walter Mercado, or Shanti Ananda, was a Puerto Rican actor, astrologer, and TV personality. Viewers loved his segment Walter y Las Estrellas at the end of Primer Impacto. He later disappeared from the limelight due to a tiff with his manager, Bill Bakula. The Netflix documentary Mucho Mucho Amor talks about his life.

Puerto Rican-born guitarist and songwriter Omar Rodríguez-López is best known as the frontman of the progressive rock group The Mars Volta. At 17, he dropped out of high school, hitchhiked throughout the country, and joined the group At the Drive-In. He is also an amateur filmmaker and photographer.

Chi-Chi Rodríguez

(Puerto Rican Professional Golfer)

14

2

Birthdate: October 23, 1935

Sun Sign: Libra

Birthplace: Rio Piedras, Puerto Rico

Chi-Chi Rodríguez is a Puerto Rican golfer best known for winning eight PGA Tour titles between 1963 and 1979. In 1989, he won two prestigious awards, namely the Old Tom Morris Award and the Bob Jones Award. In 1992, Chi-Chi Rodríguez became the first Puerto Rican to be made an inductee of the World Golf Hall of Fame.
